column4: anyone know how to fix the white screen issue trying to run compiz under a freshly upgraded gutsy install with nvidia drivers?
Complain to Nvidia to get their drivers fixed or open sourced
Yes, it's a bug that has been in their drivers since they first "supported" compiz
Their is a work around for it, but it makes things slower
oh, and the 9746 drivers worked just fine with compiz.  do you think would downgrading help?
Are all of the windows white?
Ahh, that is not the bug I refereed too :)
could you point me towards a better resource for this?  google has a few hits, but maybe i am not using the right keywords (compiz nvidia white screen)
Wait, that's not the right channel :)
I believe the 32 bit -server kernel can see > 4 GIG RAM, though I don't know about 16G
If you currently have windows installed you can install Ubuntu without repartitioning, just insert the Ubuntu CD and it should give you that option
no, i will be installing over my existing 32bit ubuntu-server install
want to know if i can move my etc home, opt, etc dirs into a hold dir, then install over the top without loosing all my dirs in the hold dir
What you want to do is possible with debootsrap but is fairly complicated
